metadata.title: CVE-2016-6796 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
A malicious web application running on Apache Tomcat 9.0.0.M1 to 9.0.0.M9,8.5.0 to 8.5.4, 8.0.0.RC1 to 8.0.36, 7.0.0 to 7.0.70 and 6.0.0 to 6.0.45was able to bypass a configured SecurityManager via manipulation of theconfiguration parameters for the JSP Servlet.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6796` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libservlet3.1-java - 8.0.38-2
libtomcat8-embed-java - 8.0.38-2
libtomcat8-java - 8.0.38-2
tomcat8 - 8.0.38-2
tomcat8-admin - 8.0.38-2
tomcat8-common - 8.0.38-2
tomcat8-examples - 8.0.38-2
tomcat8-user - 8.0.38-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tomcat8 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.0.38-2').
